Hey @paparent! The removal of Pinax is still up for debate. Its a perfectly good system for most projects but in the case of Packaginator all we are using at this point is for registration.
Which means we've added about 8 MB of dependencies - which makes it more challenging for us to migrate forwards
However, I happily use Pinax on other projects and really enjoy it. Talk about your UBER shortcuts. Just at this point it isn't giving us enough functionality to other dependencies.
Pinax (especially the 0.9 work) is perfectly appropriate even if you just need registration
that's what things like account_project are for; and even if you don't need that much, there's zero_project
so, I'm completely dismayed by this thread
what is pinax.idios? I've never heard of such a thing.
@brosner you are right - it was my error in thinking that idios, as used was in pinax.apps - but as the grep test I did showed, it looks essentially uncoupled from pinax.
I want to take a good look at fresh-start before we move any further on this issue.
I will say it would be nice to have some of the dependencies (Idios being an excellent example), given a formal release on PyPI.
